channel.title: jdbc on Roy Tang
channel.description: Recent content in jdbc on Roy Tang

item.title: Reply to 'how to reference an oracle pl/sql out parameter of table%rowtype as an object in java' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8483352/how-to-reference-an-oracle-pl-sql-out-parameter-of-tablerowtype-as-an-object-in:
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Reply to 'how to reference an oracle pl/sql out parameter of table%rowtype as an object in java' on stackoverflow at https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8483352/how-to-reference-an-oracle-pl-sql-out-parameter-of-tablerowtype-as-an-object-in:

“rowtype” here is an Oracle PL/SQL-specific type, I don’t think it would be supported by JDBC. A quick search of the oracle forums (google “jdbc rowtype site:oracle.com”) suggests the same. You’re probably better off returning a cursor, or just execute the SQL from JDBC directly.

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description: I know the oci driver can perform transparent failover of the database, but does the thin driver have the same capability?
